main_definition: Major League Baseball (MLB) is the professional baseball organization that governs the highest level of play in North America.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Major League Baseball, an association for professional American and Canadian baseball
meanings_and_examples.example: The New York Yankees are a team in Major League Baseball.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A level of competition above minor leagues within the sport of baseball in North America
meanings_and_examples.example: Babe Ruth started his career playing in the MLB before moving to the Brooklyn Dodgers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The governing body for professional baseball in North America, responsible for organizing and managing Major League Baseball games
meanings_and_examples.example: MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred oversees all aspects of the MLB season and its teams.
